Gentlemen:
The City of San Francisco for some time past has been
endeavoring to secure a suitable, tract of land for municipal air
port purposes.
We had under investigation sites at South San Francisco,
millbrae, South of San Mateo and lands under water at San Mateo
Point easterly of your property.
We found that it would be
impracticable to select a permanent site until we had gathered.
sufficient data in regar the fog and wind conditions, as this
data is not available at the present time.
We finally leased from the Mills Estate a temporary field
for a perlod of three years, with the privilege of extension of an
additional. two years.
It is our idea to establish small meteorological stations
on or near sites under contemplation, and to ascertain the fog and
wind conditions over a period of twelve months.
The work will
in charge of men assigned to us by the United States Weather Bureau.
